content:
Section 10 outlines the Governing Law, stating that any interpretation of this Policy relating to its construction, validity, or operation shall be made in accordance with the Laws of Singapore.

Section 11 discusses Jurisdiction, clarifying that notwithstanding anything stated herein to the contrary, the indemnity provided by this Policy shall not apply in respect of judgments which are not in the first instance delivered by or obtained from a court of competent jurisdiction within the Republic of Singapore nor to orders obtained in the said court for the enforcement of judgments made outside the Republic of Singapore.
questions: What laws govern the interpretation of this Policy?
Where must judgments be delivered for the indemnity to apply?
Does this Policy cover judgments obtained from courts outside Singapore?
What is stated in Section 10 regarding the construction of the Policy?
Are there any exceptions to the indemnity provided by this Policy?
What does Section 11 clarify about jurisdiction?
Can judgments from non-competent courts be enforced under this Policy?
What is the significance of the Republic of Singapore in this Policy?
How does the Policy define 'competent jurisdiction'?
What should one consider regarding the enforcement of judgments made outside Singapore?
